mdRecord.dcterms:title: Tea Room, April 22, 1930
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Schneckenburger, Martin G., 1884-1950
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Tea Room located outside the Texas Gate as Mount Vernon with busses and vehicles parked nearby. The structure served at the waiting room and ticket office for the Washington, Alexandria, and Mount Vernon Railway stop at Mount Vernon from 1907-1930. The train tracks have recently been removed to make way for the construction of the George Washington Memorial Parkway which opened in 1932.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: p Tea Room
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: Mount Vernon Black and White Film Collection
